availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Kimbrough (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Susan Jones Kimbrough in Nicholas County, Kentucky, on January 27, 1831. Father of John J. Kimbrough, Samuel Kimbrough, Elizabeth Kimbrough, Alexander Kimbrough, Henry Kimbrough, William Kimbrough, Sarah Kimbrough, Nanie Kimbrough, and Moses Kimbrough. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 164B-165A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 422.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 22.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nicholas County Marriages, Film 000252400.
"John M. Kimbrough (1806-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial 43076983, accessed April 14, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/43076983.
